wikipedia_page.main: Sir Roderick Roy Wilson (10 August 1876 – 27 August 1942) was a British banker and politician, Conservative MP for Lichfield from 1924 to 1929, and appointed Knight Bachelor in 1929.  A portrait is in the National Portrait Gallery.Wilson played cricket at minor counties level for Cheshire from 1909–1913, making six appearances in the Minor Counties Championship.
